output.name: Audiovisual Communications Laboratory

githubOrganizationMetadata.name: Audiovisual Communications Laboratory
githubOrganizationMetadata.description: The mission of the Audiovisual Communications laboratory is to perform basic and applied research in signal processing for communications.

output.organizationTypeJustification: The Audiovisual Communications Laboratory (LCAV) is a university-affiliated research laboratory housed in the Institute of Communication Systems (I&C) at EPFL, with a stated mission of basic and applied research, multiple publications, and an EPFL lab listing.
output.description: The mission of the Audiovisual Communications laboratory is to perform basic and applied research in signal processing for communications.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Official EPFL organizational unit found in Infoscience with matching name and GitHub metadata

disciplineJustification: The LCAV mission is “signal processing for communications,” a core area of Electrical engineering.
Repositories such as pyroomacoustics and dsp-labs implement signal algorithms, tying to Computer engineering.
The focus on communications systems and data processing aligns with Information engineering.
Complex audio‐visual systems research and hardware prototyping involve system‐level engineering, i.e. Systems science and engineering.
output.relatedToEPFLJustification:
1. Parent Organization (0.6): The Audiovisual Communications Laboratory is listed with parent organization “École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne” in relatedToOrganization metadata, indicating direct institutional linkage to EPFL.
2. Website Domain (0.5): The GitHub 'blog' field is “lcav.epfl.ch,” an EPFL subdomain, demonstrating an official EPFL web presence.
3. Location Field (0.2): The GitHub location is “I&C, EPFL, Switzerland,” explicitly naming EPFL in its geographical affiliation.
4. Infoscience Entity (0.4): The lab appears as an official orgunit in EPFL’s Infoscience repository, confirming its status as an EPFL research laboratory.
Summing these weights yields 1.7, capped at 1.0, which exceeds the 0.5 threshold for a definitive EPFL relationship.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Exact match on full name and affiliation from lab profile found via search_infoscience_authors_tool

entity.title: Optimization Notes
entity.abstract: While optimization is well studied for real-valued functions $f : \mathbb{R}^{N} \to \mathbb{R}$, many physical problems are (partially) specified in terms of complex-valued functions $f_{c} : \mathbb{C}^{N} \to \mathbb{C}^{M}$. Current optimization packages have limited support for such functions.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Authored by Sepand Kashani, retrieved from his publications list

entity.title: Towards Real-Time High-Resolution Interferometric Imaging with Bluebild
entity.abstract: Rooted in radio-astronomy, the Bluebild algorithm is a paradigm-changing imager to estimate the sky intensity function. entity.title: Computational Imaging: a Multi-Facet Perspective
entity.abstract: Computational Imaging (CI) is the field concerned with reconstructing images of some quantity of interest from a finite number of measurements. It is pervasive in science and engineering problems by enabling the reconstruction of images from a variety of measurements that are often indirect or non-t...

entity.title: Robust, Generalizable, and Reproducible Computational Imaging: A Lensless Perspective
entity.abstract: Computational imaging combines innovative camera designs with physics-informed algorithms to enable new sensing capabilities, modalities, and applications. Such cameras can relax optical design constraints and enable encoding of higher-dimensional data.

academicCatalogRelations.justification: Doctoral thesis by Eric Bezzam retrieved from his author publications

entity.title: Generalizing Learning-Based Lensless Image Reconstruction to Mask Pattern Changes
entity.abstract: Lensless imaging seeks to replace/remove the lens in a conventional imaging system. The earliest cameras were in fact lensless, relying on long exposure times to form images on the other end of a small aperture in a darkened room/container (camera obscura). entity.title: LCAV-31: a dataset for light field object recognition
entity.abstract: We present LCAV-31, a multi-view object recognition dataset designed specifically for benchmarking light field image analysis tasks. The principal distinctive factor of LCAV-31 compared to similar datasets is its design goals and availability of novel visual information for more accurate recognition...
